snippet: The preliminary deal, worth nearly $26 billion at list prices and possibly Airbus’s largest order yet, reflects the carrier’s long-term plans for expansion.
abstract: IndiGo says that it has signed preliminary agreement to buy 250 A320neo planes from Airbus, purchase that could be worth nearly $26 billion and rank as largest single order of jets for the plane maker.
lead_paragraph: The preliminary deal, worth nearly $26 billion at list prices and possibly Airbus’s largest order yet, reflects the carrier’s long-term plans for expansion.

headline.main: IndiGo, a Low-Cost Indian Airline, Seeks to Add 250 Airbus Jets
headline.print_headline: Low-Cost Indian Airline Seeks to Add 250 Airbus Jets
